com.google.api.client.googleapis.auth.authsub
Class AuthSubHelper

java.lang.Object
  com.google.api.client.googleapis.auth.authsub.AuthSubHelper

public final class AuthSubHelper
extends Object

AuthSub token manager for a single user.

To properly initialize, set:

  • setToken(java.lang.String): single-use or session token (required)
  • transport: Google transport (recommended)
  • privateKey: private key for secure AuthSub (recommended)

Since:
1.0
Author:
Yaniv Inbar

Nested Class Summary

          Key/value data to parse a success response for an AuthSubSessionToken request.
static class AuthSubHelper.TokenInfoResponse
          Key/value data to parse a success response for an AuthSubTokenInfo request.

Method Detail

setPrivateKey

public void setPrivateKey(PrivateKey privateKey)
Sets to the given private key for secure AuthSub or null for non-secure AuthSub.

Updates the authorization header of the Google transport (set using setTransport(HttpTransport)).

setTransport

public void setTransport(HttpTransport transport)
Sets to the given Google transport whose authorization header to set or null to ignore (for example if using an alternative HTTP library).

Updates the authorization header of the Google transport.

setToken

public void setToken(String token)
Sets to the given single-use or session token (or resets any existing token if null).

Any previous stored single-use or session token will be forgotten. Updates the authorization header of the Google transport (set using setTransport(HttpTransport)).

exchangeForSessionToken

public String exchangeForSessionToken()
                               throws IOException
Exchanges the single-use token for a session token as described in AuthSubSessionToken. Sets the authorization header of the Google transport using the session token, and automatically sets the token used by this instance using setToken(String).

Note that Google allows at most 10 session tokens per use per web application, so the session token for each user must be persisted.

Returns:
session token
Throws:
HttpResponseException - if the authentication response has an error code
IOException - some other kind of I/O exception

revokeSessionToken

public void revokeSessionToken()
                        throws IOException
Revokes the session token. Clears any existing authorization header of the Google transport and automatically resets the token by calling setToken(null).

See AuthSubRevokeToken for protocol details.

Throws:
HttpResponseException - if the authentication response has an error code
IOException - some other kind of I/O exception

requestTokenInfo

public AuthSubHelper.TokenInfoResponse requestTokenInfo()
                                                 throws IOException
Retries the token information as described in AuthSubTokenInfo.

Throws:
HttpResponseException - if the authentication response has an error code
IOException - some other kind of I/O exception
